Peak load reduction (PR).value:
Implicit Yes
Committed STOR has strict service terms to be available for service windows, and PN's for purpose of baselining must be equal to or less than zero. But as Peak Reduction is for long-term demand reduction, which would have PNs below zero, FSPs may be able to stack with STOR for further demand reduction. This is likely to be in the same direction only.

Scheduled Utilisation (SU).value:
Implicit No
Committed STOR has strict service terms to be available for service windows, and PNs for purpose of baselining must be equal to or less than zero. Although there could be limited circumstance for splitting, instances for splitting may be rare and limited to demand reduction.

Committed STOR has strict service terms to be available for service windows, and PN's for purpose of baselining must be equal to or less than zero. But as Peak Reduction is for long-term demand reduction, which would have PNs below zero, FSPs may be able to stack with STOR for further demand reduction. This is likely to be in the same direction only.

Dynamic Containment (DC).value:
Implicit Yes
Peak reduction dispatch is agreed in advance. This should enable providers to deliver ESO response and reserve services in the same direction. Over-delivery on DNO obligation is likely. This also may depend on the precise delivery periods the DNOs use, as these could vary between DNOs.

Dynamic Moderation (DM).value:
Implicit Yes
Peak reduction dispatch is agreed in advance. This should enable providers to deliver ESO response and reserve services in the same direction. Over-delivery on DNO obligation is likely. This also may depend on the precise delivery periods the DNOs use, as these could vary between DNOs.

Dynamic Regulation (DR).value:
Implicit Yes

Static Firm Frequency Response (SFFR).value:
Implicit Yes
Peak reduction dispatch is agreed in advance. This should enable providers to deliver ESO response and reserve services in the same direction. Over-delivery on DNO obligation is likely.

Demand Flexibility Service (DFS).value:
Explicit Yes
According to the current design for DFS 3.0. Assets will be able to revenue stack with DNO services for winter 24/25. This must be in the same direction to ensure both services requirements are met.

MW Dispatch.Structure|When Prices are Set: Day Ahead (16:00) submission of Utilisation Rate
MW Dispatch.Metering|Asset metering permitted (vs bo: Asset Metering (using the DSO measurements from site)
MW Dispatch.Metering|Operational Metering Latency:
Seconds
Error message sent to DSO after 2 min gap
MW Dispatch.Platforms|Settlement Registration Platfo: Calculated in Settlements BAU process / solution using Instruction and Metering data provided from ASDP and Pricing data provided from SMP
MW Dispatch.Availability |Availability/utilisation p: Units are assumed to be available unless ESO is notified by the DSO via an unavailability / risk of conflict report aheasd of time or real time availability flag update
MW Dispatch.Utilisation |Instruction Notice Period (: Real time - compliance expected within 2 minutes (NGED) and 12 minutes (UKPN - 10 minute safety window + 2 minute response time)
MW Dispatch.Utilisation |Gate closure: After - price submission at 16:00 on a given day used for next day dispatch payment calculation (from 05:00)
MW Dispatch.Utilisation |Auction contract length: Unspecified - open ended until issue of a Cease instruction
MW Dispatch.Settlement & Performance Monitoring|Sett: Settlement process identifies any non compliance (outside 2 minute stipulation or output increase above the agreed deadband within any Settlement period)
MW Dispatch.Baselining|Baselining: Real time metering output as advised to ESO via 15 second refresh used to calculate volume of MW delivered in service (assumes an immediate and constant reduction to zero)

DFS.Structure|When Prices are Set: Within day submission of utilisation rate
DFS.Metering|Asset metering permitted (vs bo: Asset level metering permitted (but with ad hoc boundary meter checks)
DFS.Utilisation |Instruction Trigger: Tender result will be seen as instruction
DFS.Settlement & Performance Monitoring|Sett: All performance is reviewed by market monitoring team to ensure accurate payment vs delivered.

Balancing Mechanism.Utilisation |Maximum Recovery Period: UNIT SELF DEFINE for recovery at 0MW only
Balancing Mechanism.Settlement & Performance Monitoring|Sett: Yes (settlement of BOAs) and performance monitoring via imbalance

requirement_categories.name: Strategic Direction
requirement_categories.description: The high level plan for the service in the near future. (Enduring, medium term, or non-enduring).

requirement_categories.name: Payment Structure
requirement_categories.description:
How the service is structured 
(i.e. what is the DSO 
asking of the FSP)

requirement_categories.name: Procurement Method
requirement_categories.description: The type of mechanism used to procure the service

requirement_categories.name: When Prices are Set
requirement_categories.description: Time before use that prices are determined

requirement_categories.name: Generation/demand turn down service or demand turn up service?
requirement_categories.description: Does the service require the provider to export or import power to the grid

requirement_categories.name: Required to be a Balancing and Settlement Code (BSC) Party
requirement_categories.description: The rules and governance arrangements for electricity balancing and settlement in Great Britain.

requirement_categories.name: Non-BM Party Accessible
requirement_categories.description: Participate without being a Balancing Mechanism Party

requirement_categories.name: Asset Location Grouping Requirement
requirement_categories.description: Requirement for where multiple assets within a unit must be located

requirement_categories.name: Aggregation /Virtual Lead Party (VLP) Route Available
requirement_categories.description: The option of having more than a single asset within a unit

requirement_categories.name: Minimum MW Delivery Required (also referred to as Minimum Aggregated Unit Size)
requirement_categories.description: The minimum MW delivery rate that a unit must exceed to enter the service

requirement_categories.name: Unit volume cap
requirement_categories.description: Maximum amount of MW volume per unit registered in the service

requirement_categories.name: Open to Flexible Connections or similar?
requirement_categories.description: If the asset's network connection has 'restrictions' (eg a Curtailable, Flexible or Ramped connection), can they participate?

requirement_categories.name: Planned Connection
requirement_categories.description: Identifying when assests must be connected to the network before participating in flexibility market.

requirement_categories.name: Asset metering permitted (vs boundary point metering system)
requirement_categories.description: What type of metering is permitted? Some services only allow boundary meter data whilst others allow metering behind the boundary i.e. asset metering

requirement_categories.name: Operational Metering Required
requirement_categories.description: A live feed to ESO control room to measure providers live service delivery

requirement_categories.name: Operational Meter Accuracy Required
requirement_categories.description: The accuracy rating required of physical meters providing operational metering

requirement_categories.name: Operational Meter Refresh Frequency
requirement_categories.description: The frequency that the physical meter captures real-time data snapshots

requirement_categories.name: Operational Metering Latency
requirement_categories.description: Operational metering data must reach the ESO Control Room within this time

requirement_categories.name: Operational Metering Signal Type
requirement_categories.description: The type of electrical data collected for operational metering

requirement_categories.name: Performance Meter Refresh Frequency
requirement_categories.description: The frequency that the physical meter captures real-time data snapshots (e.g. 20Hz= 20 snapshots per second)

requirement_categories.name: Service Registration Platform
requirement_categories.description: The platform used to register to enter the service

requirement_categories.name: Procurement Platform
requirement_categories.description: The platform that providers use to receive instructions and bid into the service

requirement_categories.name: Settlement Registration Platform
requirement_categories.description: The platform to register and submit settlement data

requirement_categories.name: Availability/utilisation period
requirement_categories.description: the periods in which the service is made available or utilisation is committed (e.g., settlement periods, EFA block, committed blocks, etc.)

requirement_categories.name: Availability Payment Unit
requirement_categories.description: The units used for Availability Payments

requirement_categories.name: Instruction Notice Period (also referred to as Utilisation Instruction Timings)
requirement_categories.description: Notice given to providers that they will need to respond to an instruction in the immediate future

requirement_categories.name: Gate closure
requirement_categories.description: Dispatched before or after gate closure

requirement_categories.name: Delivery Duration (also referred to as Minimum Utilisation Time)
requirement_categories.description: Minimum amount of time that a provider must be able to provide its obligated delivery volume

requirement_categories.name: Availability/utilisation period
requirement_categories.description: the periods in which the service is made available or utilisation is committed (e.g., settlement periods, EFA block, committed blocks, etc.)

requirement_categories.name: Time to respond to instruction
requirement_categories.description: Time to show unit ramping has began

requirement_categories.name: Max time to full delivery from Instruction (also referred to as Maximum Response Time)
requirement_categories.description: Time taken from utilisation instruction or triggering event to reach procured volume delivery

requirement_categories.name: Ramping requirements
requirement_categories.description: The specific requirements of the service in relation to ramping up or down of delivery

requirement_categories.name: Maximum Recovery Period
requirement_categories.description: Minimum time between separate instructions and providers must be ready to respond again

requirement_categories.name: Instruction Trigger
requirement_categories.description: What triggers a request to deliver the contracted volume

requirement_categories.name: Auction contract length
requirement_categories.description: How long the providers delivery contract lasts

requirement_categories.name: Utilisation Payment Unit
requirement_categories.description: The units used for Utilisation payments

requirement_categories.name: Settlement or performance monitoring required?
requirement_categories.description: Identification of any service specific perfromace monitoring requirements.

requirement_categories.name: Baselining
requirement_categories.description: The historical baseline data used to calculate delivery performance and inform settlement
